title: Missing trailing expression in block with `let else` yields incorrectly spanned error message

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(let_else)]

pub fn test(a: Option<u32>) -> Option<u32> {
    let Some(_) = a else { return None; };
    println!("Foo");
}

fn main() {}
```

I expected to see this happen: A helpful error message pointing to the end of the block.

Instead, this happened: An error message with a wrong span:

```rust
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> test.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     let Some(_) = a else { return None; };
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected enum `Option`, found `()`
  |
  = note:   expected enum `Option<u32>`
          found unit type `()`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
```
